title: Email sender icons
creator: ThurstonOR
content:
eMClient generates nice, colorful, easily identified icons in the email list. For example, an email from Redfin is a bright, big, red R. From Bark, a blue dog. From Zillow, the Zillow symbol.

This is a great feature when visually searching the Inbox.

Is there a means to have Thunderbird do this?

title: I see my exact problem in a supposedly fixed bug report, but it has not been fixed for me
creator: jenniferehle1
content:
Whenever I reopen Thunderbird 140esr (it has this behavior on 140.0, 140.1.0 and now 140.2.0), there is a second lower case "thunderbird" process that causes 50-150% CPU usage in the two processes. Also if I quit with both processes active I get an error message that "thunderbird" has unexpectedly quit. If I quit the "thunderbird" process with Activity Monitor the CPU issues go away for as long as the Thunderbird app is open.

I found this exact issue as a reported bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1977514&_gl=1*1coyjyr*_ga*ODYxNzE0NjQyLjE2OTY0NDU3MDg.*_ga_2VC139B3XV*czE3NTY2OTAwOTckbzMkZzEkdDE3NTY2OTAyMzYkajI0JGwwJGgw It says that it was fixed, though, and it has not been for me. Does that mean it's only been fixed in versions not yet released, or is it already (incorrectly) believed to be fixed for everyone? Thank you.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:141.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/141.0

title: outbound emails landing in recipients spam folders
creator: om30
content: Our emails have been set up to download from the host server to a gmail account (to reduce storage requirement on host as Gmail is 15gb free) when we reply it sends via our host server to keep the preferred email address (don't want business emails going out with gmail.com address). However we are now finding out that 95% of our emails are landing in spam folders/promo folders or bouncing back. Our host thinks this is caused by using Thunderbird (adding another layer of diversion) even though it was his suggestion that we use Thunderbird in the first place. I like the package as it allows me to see multiple email addresses all in the one package and I don't have any issues with the other email accounts, and I don't have to have multiple tabs open in chrome to view emails. I know you're probably going to say that it's the inclusion of the additional Gmail account that is causing this issue, I just need confirmation to take to him Thanks in advance for your assistance.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/139.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Downloading all emails ... again
creator: stuarte83
content:
Hi,

Last weekend I installed Thunderbird v128.14.0esr (64-bit) onto my (fully updated) Debian Bookworm laptop. I then set Thunderbird to synchronise with my Gmail account. This resulted in Thunderbird downloading all 96,970 emails then in my Gmail account onto my hdd using IMAP. This was just what I wanted.

This morning, when using Thunderbird, it once again started to download all(!!) the emails in my Gmail account. [This now stands at 102,205 messages, though I really[!!] doubt that I received 5,235 messages over the weekend. :) ] With my relatively slow download bandwidth bouncing around the 50 KiBs/s mark, this will take hours.

What I'd like to know is that, once this large download is complete, how do I then set Thunderbird so that it will download only(!!) new messages from that point onward ?

Stuart
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/128.0

content:

All suggestions that will help me move over to Thunderbird will be appreciated.

Thank you.

title: Thunderbird scarica la posta certificata (da Infocert) solo all'avvio del programma
creator: vittoriodellagli
content: Buonasera, come da oggetto volevo segnalare una anomalia che si presenta da un po di tempo, circa 7/8 mesi, ossia utilizzando il client di thunderbird per scaricare posta certificata da Infocert, questa viene scaricata solo all'avvio di thunderbird mentre poi successivamente questo non avviene piu, a meno di chiudere e riaprire il client, allora compare il messaggio (o i messaggi) evidenziati in grassetto. Ne tantomeno ci sono notifiche di arrivo di nuovi messaggi. Chiedo se per voi questo e' un problema noto oppure non vi e' mai capitato qualcosa del genere. Tengo costantemente aggiornato alla versione piu recente, non ricordo bene ma non vorrei che questo succeda forse proprio a seguito di un aggiornamento e aggiungo che i parametri sono sempre settati come da default e non sono mai stati cambiati, il problema si e' presentato all'improvviso. Aggiungo che allo stato attuale non ho ancora provato con altri programmi di posta (es. outlook) per vedere se succede lo stesso problema, vorrei evitare di abbandonare thunderbird solo per questo problema perche al momento lo utilizzo anche per altri account di posta e quindi poi sarei costretto ad utilizzarne due diversi per gestire le caselle o comunque a fare una migrazione totale per trasferire tutti gli account al nuovo client, anche perche poi a parte questo incoveniente mi trovo bene con questo applicativo. Aggiungo che ho anche contattato Infocert per avere qualche delucidazione e sapere se tante volte avessero cambiato qualche parametro di configurazione ma la risposta e' stata negativa. In attesa di qualche suggerimento porgo distinti saluti. Grazie, buonasera. Vittorio Dell'Agli
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:142.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/142.0

title: Deleted email continually tries to access my website and gets my IP blocked
creator: russ3800
content:
We have an email on one of our computers that was removed and when that computer starts up it tries to access our website and then our web host blocks our IP address. If it tries to access our web site more than 5 times in 3600 seconds we get our IP address blocked.

I have looked everywhere in that computer to try and find where the culprit email is located, but I have found nothing.

We are running version 140.2 on Widows 10. I really don't want to reinstall Windows, but!! A,d I have been working on this for 3 weeks and it took me 2 weeks to locate the computer that was getting me blocked. Our IP address has unblocked at lest 20 times.

Russ

title: Is there a way to migrate mbox email accounts with account settings but maildir as their mail stores in new profile?
creator: birdman
content:
I have been trying to migrate all my accounts to maildir, but Export/Import doesn't work.

Even after I ensure that the old profile is backed up in another location and deleted from the previous path, and then I try "/mac path/thunderbird -P" and the first thing I do is set "maildir" as the storage for new accounts in settings.

After that, I imported (only accounts and settings) from the backed-up profile .zip, but the mail store type per account gets overridden by the old profile, it seems, and is set to "mbox" (uneditable).

Is there a way to retain the settings except for the mail store type? I am fine with entering every password again; I just hope to not have to do all the config again (settings for subscribe, junk, etc… and… what not) again for all those accounts.

Can I do it via prefs.js, etc.? If so, will I have to modify something in those files? What files will be needed?

title: My computer is acting as though Thunderbird is not installed.
creator: pyrfectpup
content:
I recently started using Thunderbird for my verizon/aol account. Aol helped me and there were many problems. I thought everything was OK. When I logged on this morning, my messages were there. After going through today's messages, I left Thunderbird.

When I tried to send a message there are problems. First, no new messages downloaded, which is unusual. Second, when I clicked on 'new message' nothing happened. When I click on the TB icon on my desktop, it wants to start off at the beginning downloading and installing. Since I've already had a hard time with this, I will not attempt it by myself.

Yesterday I was able to type out an email, but TB would not send it. After aol worked with it, I could send out an email.

I think some of the problem is related to the fact that my email account is @verizon, but it is now serviced through aol.

title: Thunderbird notifications when returning from sleep mode?
creator: chris_cuddy
content: I am running Thunderbird on Windows 11 Pro. I have notifications turned on because I like getting Windows notifications for incoming mail as it is received. The problem though is what happens when I use the PC after it has been in sleep mode for a period of time. When I wake the PC from sleep, I will begin getting notifications for all emails received during the period when it was sleeping. The notifications come one after another and it can sometimes take several minutes to get through all of them. Is there a setting somewhere that will prevent individual notifications being sent for each email like that?
